name: afastidioushat
text:
I purchased the World Time Zone Chart but the unit did not transfer to my university.

How oh how will I get my five dollars back?

name: straw
text: I'm afraid that's one of those situations where you just take the experience in half-hearted reminiscence and move on with your bad self.

name: mikeleffel2
text: Next to Friday Facts, this kind of stuff is the best!

name: cygnusx-1
text: I agree!

name: aparrish
text: Slipping "Intro to Watercolors" in there - kind of cheap, but mostly brilliant.

name: carterst
text: This gets a 5 for "Hate is a Fag"

name: afrothunder
text: I am Bi, and I can not imagine NOT taking that course if I actually found it.

name: byronic
text: I do need to study up on my timezones.

name: pohlhoud
text: Any italians can confirm?

name: pa_ass_nts
text: I read in a newspaper that they have a lot of car crashes because of text messaging, so it must be true.

name: slalvation
text: When I read that bit in the comic I remembered that I think I heard something once about how they text message a lot in Italy, so it must be true.

name: wite_rabit
text: I'm an American but I'm half Sicilian - I love T9.

name: belgand
text: Quiet you! Don't reveal to them that you're from the future. In local time Terminator 4 hasn't even quite come out yet.

name: terriblerobot
text:
I'm an American who is half Sicilian - I hate T9.
Did...did I just find my evil twin? Or am I your evil twin?

name: semiquaver
text: Is that Robert Duvall?

name: jollysaintpete
text: A comment left by jollysaintpete was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by mistlethrush, ravindra108, clintisiceman)

name: semiquaver
text: in that hat with those cheeks he so does

name: pohlhoud
text: it actually Is Robert Duvall, in those old The Godfather days.

name: semiquaver
text:
Oh my god did I call it.

Right from the source.

name: stuart
text: A perfect time capsule for what was popular in 2004

name: thesyndicate88
text: Where do they get the parts? Does the teacher work for Cadillac? And even if he does, how does he get parts from 30 to 50 years ago? Must cost a fortune.

name: tellumo
text: I would LOVE to take Auto Shop 154, as long as the lab fee wasn't too steep (those A-daptor kits ain't cheap these days).

name: hawaiian_robot
text: Ideally there should be no extra costs associated, yes.

name: professoryes
text:
I took "Hate is a Fag" my freshman year. Since I already was gay, its curriculum changed itself accordingly to "Hate THIS Fag."

I'd like to think we had some great times. Great growth. Stayed off a few beaches.

name: epicurus
text: Go muscles!

name: jlowe424
text: ...whilst punching himself in the face...

name: spinynorman
text: I emailed the fuck out of these community college samples.

name: ringwoodcomics
text: "Electives!" must be followed by a sound effect trumpet at all times.

name: semiquaver
text: Yay, muscles!

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Pat: Back in the Saddle!
Teodor: We're at base camp.
Philippe: New trash can!
Lyle: pulled
Little Nephew: Squeeze squeezes

name: le_baron_noir
text:
Quote:
I also grabbed one by some band called Squeeze, just the gayest...

If Little Nephew can't find a workable sample in "Take Me, I'm Yours," he needs to step away from the table.

name: pantscomeoff
text: The cartoonist has a mediocre opinion of community colleges

name: bixschmix
text: Listening to sad music DOES make me sad!

name: sp1derbaby
text: Does emotional music have quite an effect on you?

name: acefalco
text: I cannot say enough good things about Faith No More, or your acumen for knowing that lyric. Well done, sir.

name: apocowarg
text:
They lifted that lyric from a Scientology personality test. They also used two others "Do you often sing or whistle just for fun?" and %u201CDo you feel sometimes that age is against you?%u201D.

I don't know why I felt compelled to share my pointless Faith No More trivia with you but there you go.

name: apocowarg
text:
ASSETBAR!
BBCODE!
APPLESAUCE!

name: woodenteeth
text: Assetbar BBcode Applesauce! Delicious! Pour it all over my Assetbar BBcode Lamb Choppies.

name: woodenteeth
text: Also... you are awesome for relating this FNM factoid. Mike Patton is a wonderful, confusing man.

name: charchar
text:
Look what I found.

It's all in French, which makes me feel powerful. C'est Radical pour votre sante!

name: heccibiggs
text: So, I wasn't the only one who typed Crepes Suzette into Google, hoping it was a real band?

name: charchar
text: Nor were you the only one who felt the slings and arrows of disillusionment when all you found was a techno recipe.

name: haradaya
text: A pretty good recipe. Pancakes man, pancakes

name: pogo
text: I would like to watch.

name: unityrolf
text:
Crepes Suzette is, I am assuming, a reference to the band Stereo Total, Who:

1. Are French
2. Are sample driven, often sampling themselves
3. Are upbeat (no sad music to make you sad)
4. Have a song called L'Amour a 3, which is an ode to threesomes and includes several orgasm samples. I would encourage anyone to check them out.

name: charchar
text: Done and done.

name: unityrolf
text:
I've seen this video before; it is strange that they used German lyrics for it. The radio and album versions had the original French lyrics. Some kind soul has dubbed them over the video here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RV4H3z60h6w

name: belgand
text:
That dude has brought awkward white male dancing to a new level. Does he teach a community college course on it? I'm kinda rusty, but I feel like I could be rustier.

Also, how has it been this long before we had a proper song sung by an attractive lady about the importance of having sex with both a dude and another lady together. This seems like a crucial area of human expression.

name: nosearmy
text: I read this as referring to all French music, possibly owing to the influence of Serge.

name: greenkoolayd
text:
stereolab

is having the word 'stereo' in the band name a french thing, or am i being overly dramatic?

name: hellofditties
text: Was eating chicken ever unpopular?

name: zathyr
text:
In certain places and times chicken was considered a food for poor people because they could not afford steak.

They are a silly places and times.

Also eating chicken is unpopular in such places where there are a lot of vegans and whatnot. Do not go into a vegetarian restaurant and order the chicken.

name: boredom_man
text:
...for Semiquaver will show up.

Christ. Sorry, everybody.

name: pigs
text: I gave this a 5 after the Al Roker one, but after the Hate is a Fag and World Time Zone ones, I wish the scale went higher.

name: mypoorhands
text: Crepes-Suzette? Dudes, that's a Tale-Spin reference!  This guy's appreciation of culture is beautiful and inspiring.

name: lunchbox
text: Damn, the alt text in this one made me smile way too hard for it not to look creepy. I want to make that car so badly.

name: tekende
text: "Muscles maintain their timeless chic" is not only the entire reason I gave this strip a 5 but is probably also the greatest sentence a man has ever written.

name: starchybunker
text: This elicited a strong desire to eat at Carl's Jr. in me, despite having never eaten there. I looked at their website and determined I could not possibly live in a place in the US that is farther away from the nearest Carl's Jr than where I am now.

name: greenkoolayd
text: i used to work at hardees(owned by carls jr.).  depending on the employees, it is decent food.  the fried chicken and biscuits are pretty rad.

name: belgand
text: Yeah, Hardee's used to be different, but sometime in the 90s or so they got bought by Carl's Jr. and are basically the same thing. The only real difference is that you can't get crappy Mexican food at Hardee's and I don't think Carl's does the whole fried chicken and biscuits thing.

name: fresco
text: I want to first post. I want this because this is assetbar. I have to go, but we can talk later. I am Fresco.

name: tekende
text: That fast food course actually sounds really interesting.

text:
